It took a U.S. release in 1975 and was retitledÂ Andy Warhol's Dracula. 
In the first years of the 1920s, a sickly and dyingÂ Count Dracula, who, as a vampire, must drink virgin blood to survive, travels fromÂ TransylvaniaÂ toÂ Italy, following his servant Anton's plan and thinking he will be more likely to find a virgin in aÂ Catholic country. Shortly after arriving in Italy, Dracula befriends Marchese di Fiore (De Sica), an impecunious Italian landowner who, with a lavish estate falling into decline, is willing to marry off one of his four daughters to the wealthy aristocrat.
